description:
This course fulfils the advance practice requirement of the Arts & Humanities major. 

Students will be creating, planning, developing, animating, compositing, and rendering their own short film/animation/interactive projects over the semester. These projects integrate animation techniques with the use of industry level software, with emphasis on research and crafting stories into finished moving images. Students will work with professional story tellers, animators, film-makers, media lawyers and producers to improve their techniques and learn about the media industry. This course is meant to develop studentsâ artistic portfolios and will culminate in a screening at the end of the semester.
title: Advanced 2D Animation and Storytelling
prerequisite:
YHU2248 Introduction to 2D Animation and YHU2291 Introduction to Arts and with one or more of the following courses: 

YHU2222 Digital Narratives
YHU2215 Drawing Methods
YHU2237 Film and Other Arts
YHU3216 Introduction to Photojournalism
